Gu Canyang did another palm down gesture and said, â€œPlease calm down and listen to me, everyone.â€

The Legates and prolegates slowly calmed down as Gu Canyang launched into his explanation. Wei Li seized the opportunity to order the servants to serve them some tea.

After Gu Canyang was done explaining how they occupied Sunlit Mountain as well, he said, â€œIt should be clear now that Brother Yi Ye infiltrates each Outpost using different methods. In fact, both methods will not work a second time. I am sure you all understand what Iâ€™m saying.â€

Not only that, Lu Ye had cut off Yue Meiâ€™s arm and seized the Control Gem in just two strikes. That was how Hidden Light Sanctuary and Lofty Plume Court were able to break through the Grand Ward and invade the Outpost.

The occupation of Sunlit Mountainâ€™s Outpost was even more clear cut. After Yue Mei had sent out the message, the Thousand Demon Ridge sect had immediately fortified their defenses to the point where even Lu Ye could no longer slip through the Grand Ward. He had changed his breaching method not because he wanted to, but because he had no other choice.

In fact, the main reason he succeeded was because Sunlit Mountain did not have many cultivators in their Outpost. Their total force numbered only a little over a hundred cultivators, which was why Lu Ye and ten body tempering cultivators alone were able to disorient them.

If Sunlit Mountain had fifty or even thirty more cultivators in their Outpost, then the situation wouldâ€™ve been completely different. Lu Ye and his group wouldâ€™ve just died to a rain of attacks.

For a long time, there was only silence in the main hall. Finally, the Legate with the surname Niu said, â€œSo, youâ€™re saying that weâ€™ve wasted our time coming here.â€

Gu Canyang shrugged. â€œBrother Yi Ye said that he might be able to make further attempts if his cultivation level and attainment in the Way of Wards was better, but yes, he can do no more at the moment.â€

The crowd was disappointed, but they had to admit that Gu Canyang was right.

Lu Yeâ€™s tactics were impressive, but they were also pretty easy to defend against after they had been discovered. In fact, one might say that no amount of ward bypassing techniques were enough if people were guarding the Outpost.

â€œActually, this might not necessarily be a bad thing,â€ a thin cultivator spoke up suddenly.

â€œWhat do you mean, Brother Zhao?â€

The cultivator with the surname Zhao explained, â€œIf Brother Yi Ye could breach any Grand Ward with impunity, then Thousand Demon Ridge would surely be wary of him. As long as he remained in the Spirit Creek Battlefield, he would be beset by enemies and obstacles no matter where he went. In reality, the methods he used were fairly easy to defend against. He is a threat, but not a threat that they must eliminate at all costs. Therefore, Brother Yi Ye should not be in danger for the moment.â€

They agreed with him. If Lu Yeâ€™s methods were indefensible, then Thousand Demon Ridge wouldâ€™ve been agitated beyond imagination. The previous fiasco might repeat itself, meaning that they might try every trick in the book to eliminate Lu Ye. There was no chance the young man could survive if he was visited by the champions of the Core Circle, specifically those who were named on the Roll of Supremacy.

As of now, Thousand Demon Ridge was wary of Lu Ye, but they certainly hadnâ€™t been pushed to the point of complete unscrupulousness.

â€œIt canâ€™t be helped. But dammit, Hidden Light Sanctuary and Lofty Plume Court are so lucky!â€ Someone lamented. Why hadnâ€™t Lu Yi Ye visited their Outpost? If he had, it wouldâ€™ve been them occupying their neighborsâ€™ Outpost!

â€œIndeed, it canâ€™t be helped! Hahahaha!â€ Gu Canyang guffawed. Now that he thought about it, Hidden Light Sanctuary really was incredibly lucky. If it wasnâ€™t for Lu Ye, he and Ji Yan wouldâ€™ve died in the Lost City of Xianyuan already. Their sect wouldâ€™ve been too crippled to attempt anything even if Lu Ye still possessed the skill to breach their enemyâ€™s Grand Ward. It wouldâ€™ve been hell.

Since Lu Ye could not repeat his feat, there was no point in staying any longer. The Legates and prolegates bade Gu Canyang and Wei Li goodbye, and the latter saw them off warmly.

Gu Canyang let out a small sigh of relief when the guests were finally gone. Then, he returned to the hall, sat down on the opposite side of Wei Li, and discussed the follow-up matters with him.

Around three hundred House of Wintry Blossoms cultivators and two hundred Sunlit Mountain cultivators had survived the occupation of their Outpost. They were going to rebuild their Outposts as a matter of course, but Hidden Light Sanctuary and Lofty Plume Court werenâ€™t going to make it easy for them. It was impossible to wipe out their enemies completely, but they certainly could oppress the shit out of them and lengthen their period of recovery. With luck, it would be years before either Thousand Demon Ridge factions recovered their strength.

Moreover, both Hidden Light Sanctuary and Lofty Plume Court enjoyed a lot more freedom of choice than before. They could even lend some reinforcements to nearby allies and assist them in attacking more Thousand Demon Ridge forces.

Of course, they would have to spend a good amount of time planning and discussing their future direction. Such things could not be rushed.

The duo were still in the middle of discussions when suddenly, Gu Canyang felt something and checked his Battlefield Imprint. He then sent out a message.

â€œZhao Li has returned,â€ Gu Canyang said while looking at Wei Li, â€œhas he not given up yet?â€

Zhao Li was one of the Legates who departed the Outpost a while ago. For whatever reason, the guy had chosen to return.

Wei Li pondered this for a second before answering, â€œBrother Zhao is a thoughtful man, and we have said everything we shouldâ€™ve said. I do not think he will come back just to pressure us on the same futile issue.â€

â€œIf thatâ€™s true, then why did he come back?â€

â€œHave you forgotten about the roots of the Heavenly Derivative Sect, senior brother?â€

Gu Canyang mulled over this for a moment before exclaiming in realization, â€œI see what you mean. What a cunning fellow he is, this Zhao Li. He waited until everyone was gone before sneaking his way back. He must be plotting to monopolize all the benefits.â€

We Li chuckled. â€œThat isnâ€™t necessarily true, but yes, I agree that Brother Yi Ye may not turn him down.â€

He stopped talking after that. It was because he could sense Zhao Liâ€™s presence.

â€œBrother Gu, Brother Wei,â€ Zhao Li greeted while stepping into the hall.

Gu Canyang feigned ignorance and asked, â€œDid you leave behind an item or something, Brother Zhao?â€

Zhao Li smiled. â€œNo, no. I just recalled something I forgot to tell you while I was here.â€

He then turned serious and said, â€œEarlier, I said that Brother Yi Ye should be relatively safe after the Thousand Demon Ridge figured out the whole truth, but now that I think about it, that isnâ€™t necessarily the case.â€

â€œWhat do you mean?â€

â€œIâ€™m saying that Thousand Demon Ridge may yet abandon all dignity and attack Brother Yi Ye with everything they got,â€ Zhao Li said seriously, â€œBrother Yi Ye is just an Eighth-Order cultivator, but he has already pulled off the impossible multiple times. For now, his methods are easy to defend against once youâ€™ve figured out the trick behind them, but who is to say he wouldnâ€™t come up with new, harder-to-defend tricks after his cultivation and attainment in the Way of Wards improves? Just as we hope he would be able to repeat the feat in the future, there is a good chance Thousand Demon Ridge might want to nip him in the bud. Assuming the worst, even your Outpost would not be safe, Brother Gu.â€

Gu Canyang was surprised to say the least. How did his Outpost get dragged into this?

â€œIt is no secret that Brother Yi Ye is staying in your Outpost right now. If Thousand Demon Ridge wishes to nip Brother Yi Ye in the bud even at the cost of their face, then they would already be plotting with all nearby Thousand Demon Ridge Outposts and mobilizing their forces to attack you. Worst case scenario, your Outpost would be under siege in a matter of days!â€

Gu Canyangâ€™s expression gradually turned solemn. â€œDo you really think your prediction will come true, Brother Zhao?â€

Zhao Li slowly shook his head. â€œIâ€™m not sure. As I said, it is just a possibility. This is why Iâ€™ve chosen to come back. If you donâ€™t mind, I would like to stay at your Outpost for the moment and observe the situation. Assuming that Thousand Demon Ridge is plotting something big, then the Heavenly Derivative Sect would be able to respond in time. Of course, it would be best if my fears are just fears, and nothing happens.â€

â€œThank you, Brother Zhao. You are more than welcome in our Outpost.â€

â€œBut of course. That said, I think you should inform Lofty Plume Court and all allied sects to be ready to reinforce the Outpost as soon as possible. They are closer after all.â€

â€œThat makes sense.â€ Gu Canyang nodded seriously.

â€œIf there is nothing else, then I would like to go to my temporary accommodation now. My apologies for the trouble,â€ Zhao Li said while clasping his hands together.

â€œIt is no trouble at all. Brother Wei, please take him to his room,â€ Gu Canyang said while looking at Wei Li.

Wei Li nodded and took Zhao Li to the guest area. After he returned, he saw Gu Canyang still sitting on his chair and thinking about something. Wei Li returned to his own seat and poured himself a cup of tea before asking, â€œWhat are you thinking, senior brother?â€

â€œOh, Iâ€™m just thinking how Zhao Li almost fooled me with his circuitous talk.â€

â€œHuh?â€ Wei Li looked at him in puzzlement.

Gu Canyang smiled. â€œBefore that, Brother Zhao asked to be assigned next to Brother Yi Yeâ€™s accommodation, didnâ€™t he?â€

The guest area was fairly huge and filled with detached pavilions. Right now, only Lu Ye and Ju Jia were using the facilities. While Wei Li could assign Zhao Li to any pavilion he wanted, he certainly wasnâ€™t going to refuse his guestâ€™s request if possible.

â€œYes,â€ Wei Li responded, â€œBrother Zhao asked where Brother Yi Ye lived before choosing the neighboring pavilion to stay in.â€

Gu Canyang grimaced. â€œI knew it.â€

â€œI donâ€™t understand, senior brother.â€

â€œIâ€™m saying that heâ€™s here for Lu Ye.â€

Wei Li wasnâ€™t stupid. He was just feeling a little slow after all the work he had done today. He immediately realized Gu Canyangâ€™s meaning and asked, â€œAre you saying that Brother Zhao was just distracting us with some alarmist talk?â€
